title: T'bird won't open with a "new message" option.
content: I can't write a new message when T'bird opens.
creator: denolangis11

title: Need help restoring messages missing after profile creation/deletion
content:
Last night I created a new profile in an attempt to fix a problem with downloading mail. (It turned out to be on the ISP's end.) Tonight I briefly opened two copies of Thunderbird, one with the old/original profile and one with the new profile, to make sure the download would work. I was able to download my new mail to the original profile, so I moved last night's mail from the new inbox to my original inbox in the new profile, and then deleted the new profile since I don't need it. But now the past six months' worth of mail is missing from both my inbox and my sent folder! They both jump from June 13 to yesterday. I noticed it when I had the two copies open next to each other (those messages were missing in both copies), but thought maybe it was a merge problem and hoped they would be restored when I deleted the second profile. But they weren't. I absolutely did not delete all those messages and many of them are really important. Where did they go and how can I get them back? Help!!!

p.s. Sadly I haven't backed up in a while... :-(
creator: elkatd

title: mails are not downloading
content: In my Thunderbird after updating 115.5.1 my mails are not downloading but in my mail sever i can find every thing please help me with this error.
creator: networkadmin1

title: Thunderbird gets stuck and I need to reboot my computer
content: If I shut down thunderbird by mistake and restart it, my Gmail can't be read. There is a blue line at the bottom showing it is trying to do something, but it never finishes. I close every running program, reboot, and it works fine until I mistakingly shut it down again. I have several accounts and get hundreds of emails every day. I try to keep deleting them, empty trash, and compact folders. My Imap folders in my profile are huge. Many gigabytes. I plan to migrate to a new computer and don't want to move whatever is wrong to the new computer. This means I will have to start fresh, set up the accounts, fix the signature files, etc. Then I can export the address book and import them to the new computer. This will be very time consuming. Is there some way I can delete the saved emails from the profile file and copy the rest of the profile over?
creator: patnsandy

title: Don't get unread messages number in task bar from folders other than inbox
content: I have created a few folders with varying messages filters to receive notifications from. When I get a new mail in any of them I will get the windows banner notification on the side but the Thunderbird icon on the taskbar will not get the red unread message counter. I have tried subscribing to the folders and also checking "When getting new messages for this account, always check this folder"
creator: jediren944
